main.name: Waldir Miron
main.bio1: Thanks for visiting my website! I have a broad interest in evolutionary biology, being particularly fascinated by the mechanisms and processes leading to biodiversity diversification.
main.bio2: Currently, I am postdocotral researcher at the [Biology Department from the University of Oklahoma](https://www.ou.edu/cas/biology), being mentoring by Dr. [Ingo Schlupp](https://ingoschlupp.com/). I am currently involved in many projects using livebearers fishes as model organisms. In particular, we are interested to understand the links between hybridization and asexuality, and what are the phenotypic and genomic changes that lead to evolution of asexuality in a hybrid context.
main.bio3: Growing up in a Tropical city in Brazil, I had the privilege to spend most of my childhood snorkeling and fishing in coral reefs. Ever since, fish control my mind! It was inevitable move to me to become a fish biologist, with particular interst to understand how fish came to be the amazing creatures they are! I am particulaly fascinated about diversty of sexual and reproductive biology, as well as the molecular basis that generate the endless forms we observe in nature as well as its integration with the environment. See Research for more details on the topics I am interested on!
main.bio4: On more personal notes, I consider myself as an 'aquatic creature'. Anything that surrounds the ocean, rivers, lakes and creeks sounds good to me! I like diving, swimming, or just relaxing by the water. I am also a football/soccer fan and a frustrated table tennis player!
